title: Aviation
description: London Dry Gin, Crème de Violette, Maraschino cherry Liquor,  and Lemon juice, served up, tart and slightly sweet.
recipe:
2 oz. gin
1/2 oz. lemon juice
1/2 oz. maraschino liqueur
1/4 oz. crème de violette
Shake and serve up
Garnish with and brandied cherry

title: Jack Rose
description: Applejack Whiskey, House made grenadine, Lemon Juice and Simple Syrup, served up
recipe:
1 1/2 Applejack Whiskey
3/4 oz Lemon Juice
1/2 oz simple syrup
1/4 oz House Grenadine
Shake and serve up

title: Amelia
description: Vodka, St. Germian elderflower Liqueur, Blackberry Puree, served up with a mint garnish. Pinkie up!
recipe:
1 3/4  oz Vodka
1 oz St. Germian elder flour Liqueur
3/4 Blackberry Puree
3/4 oz Lemon Juice 
Shake and serve up, Garnish with mint

title: Hawaiian Sunset
description: Tiki style drink with Lime, Lemon, Orgeat, Grenadine and Vodka, up with a sugar rim
recipe:
½ oz fresh lime juice
 ½ oz fresh lemon juice
 ½ oz orgeat syrup
 1 tsp grenadine
 1 ½ oz vodka
Shake well with ice cubes. Strain into a cocktail glass with a sugar rim.
comments: Questionable recipe

title: La Florida
description: Rum, Italian vermouth, chocolate and orange liqueurs, Grenadine and Rum, served up with an orange twist
recipe:
1 oz light Puerto Rican rum
½ oz Italian vermouth
¼ oz white crème de cacao
1 tsp Curacao or Creole Shrub
1 tsp grenadine
1 oz fresh lime juice
Shake well with ice cubes. Strain into a saucer champagne glass. Garnish with a twist of orange peel.

title: Laura's Grapefruit Cooler
description: Old Tom Gin, Dry vermouth, Orange cognac, Grapefruit juice and grapefruit bitters, served on the rocks with a grapefruit wedge
recipe:
1.5 oz  Ole Tom's Gin
3/4 oz  Lillet Blanc
3/4 oz  Grand Mariner
TBS  Orange Marmalade
2 dashes  Grapefruit bitters
3/4 oz  Grapefruit juice or Lemon Juice
1/2 oz  rich simple syrup
Top with club soda to taste
Shake and serve on the rocks, garnish with grapefruit wedge and fresh mint

title: The Last Word
description: Gin, green chartreuse, maraschino, and lime, served up
recipe:
One part gin
One part lime juice
One part green Chartreuse
One part maraschino liqueur
Shaken and served up

title: Laura's reviver
description: Gin, Leopold Orange Liqueur, dry vermouth, lemon juice and Orange Bitters served up
recipe:
1 1/2 oz gin
3/4 oz Leopold Orange liqueur
3/4 oz Lillet blanc 
1/4 oz simple syrup
3/4 oz lemon juice
2 dashes orange bitters
Shake with ice and strain.
Serve up with club soda topper and lemon slice garnish.

title: Vieux Carré
description: New Orleans classic with Cognac, Rye, Sweet vermouth and Benedictine herbal liqueur, served in a double old fashioned glass with one large ice cube and a lemon twist
recipe:
1 oz. cognac (Pierre Ferrand Ambre 10 year) 
1 oz, rye whiskey (Old Overholt)
1 oz. sweet vermouth (Carpano Antica Formula)
1 barspoon Benedictine
2 dash Peychaud's Bitters
2 dash Angostura Bitters
Stir over ice and serve up or with a large ice cube. Lemon Twist

title: Berlioni
description: Gin, Cynar and Dry Vermouth, on the rocks with orange twist
recipe:
1 oz Tanqueray dry gin
⅔ oz Cynar
½ oz Noilly Prat dry vermouth
Stir over ice then strain in to an ice filled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a large twist of orange zest.

title: Blackberry Aviation
description: Plymonth Gin, Maraschino cherry Liquor,  and Lemon juice, and Leopold's blackberry liqueur, served up
recipe:
2 oz Plymouth Gin
1/2 oz lemon juice
1/3 oz Maraschino liqueur
1/6 oz blackberry liqueur
? 1/4 oz simple syrup
Shake and serve up
Garnish with brandied cherry

title: Aperol Spritz
description: Champagne, Aperol, and club soda on the rocks
recipe:
3 oz Prosecco
2 oz Aperol
1 oz club soda
Fill large wine glass with ice, add Prosecco, then aperol, then club soda Garnish with orange slice or green olives

title: Champagne Cocktail
description: Champagne, Grand Marnier and bitters with a lemon twist. Served in a champagne flute.
recipe:
1/2 oz Grand Marnier
5 oz Brut Champagne
1 raw brown sugar cube
4 or 5 dashes Angostura bitters
1 lemon twist

Pour Grand Marnier into champagne flute, slowly fill with cold champagne.  Saturate sugar cubes with bitters on a bar spoon, drop into flute.  Twist and discard lemon peel.

title: Spring punch
description: Brandy, Lemons and Green tea on the rocks with club soda
recipe: Punch and club soda

title: Oriental Cocktail
description: Rye whiskey and lime juice, with Leopold's Orange Liqueur and sweet vermouth, served up with a cherry
recipe:
1 1/5 oz Rye whiskey
3/4 oz Sweet vermouth
3/4 oz Leopold Bros American Orange Liqueur
1/2 oz Lime juice
Shake and serve up
Garnish with Cherry or Orange Peel

title: New York Sour
description: Rye, lemon, and syrup topped with a red wine floater.
recipe:
1 3/4 oz 100 proof rye (Rittenhouse)
3/4 oz Lemon
3/4 oz simple syrup
Optional egg white
Shake with Ice and strain into fresh ice in a rocks glass.
Float  3/4 oz Malbec or Syrah on top (Fruity Red)
Garnish with Orange Peel and Cherry

title: Waterloo
description: Watermelon, Gin and Campari with Lemon and Syrup, On the rocks.
recipe:
3 oz of watermelon juice or 4  (1 x 2 inch) chunks of watermelon
3/4 oz 1:1 simple syrup
2 oz Plymouth gin
1/2 oz Lemon Juice
1/2 oz Campari
Muddle Watermelon and Syrup to a juice.  Add rest and shake with ice, strain over rocks in tall Collins Glass and top with Soda. Garnish with a watermelon wedge or Lemon Twist

title: Boulderlibation's Collaboration
description: Rye, Averna Amaro, Cocchi Americano wine, and Strega Liqueur with big ice and a lemon twist.
recipe:
1 1/2 ounces (45 ml) Wild Turkey 101 Kentucky Straight Rye Whiskey
3/4 ounce (22 ml) Cocchi Americano
1/2 ounce (15 ml) Averna
1/4 ounce (7 ml) Strega
1-2 good dashes of Cocktail Kingdom's Wormwood Bitters or Angostura
Stir with ice and strain over a large ice cube, or serve up in a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

title: The Grand Street
description: Grapefruit peel, London Gin, Punt e Mes vermouth, Cynar, Luxardo Maraschino liqueur, stirred and served up.
recipe:
1 Grapefruit Twist
2 ounces Tanqueray gin
3/4 ounce Punt e Mes
1/4 ounce Cynar
1 teaspoon Luxardo Maraschino


Muddle the Grapefruit peel in the mixing glass. Combine all liquid ingredients in an ice-filled mixing glass. Stir vigorously for about 15 to 20 seconds. Strain into cocktail glass. Rub the outside of the grapefruit peel (i.e. not the pith side) around the rim of the glass before garnishing drink with it.

title: Dark and Stormy
description: Gosling's Black Seal Rum, Lime Juice, and Ginger Beer with the addition of Velvet Falernum, on the rocks.
recipe:
1/2 oz Velvet Falernum
1/2 oz Lime Juice
1 Lime Wheel
4 Oz Ginger Beer
2 Oz Goslings Black Seal Rum

Briefly shake Falernum and juice over ice, fill with ginger beer to one inch below the rim, Slowly layer the rum on top. Garnish with Lime wheel
Or skip the layering, but don't shake the ginger beer

title: Old tom 50/50 Martini
description: Old tom gin and Dolin Blanc vermouth.  Served up with a lemon twist.
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Old Tom Gin
1 1/2 oz Dolin Blanc
Dash Orange Bitters
Stir and server up with a lemon twist.

title: The Lazy Bear
description: Bonded Rye and Smith and Cross Rum with lime juice and honey syrup, on the rocks
recipe:
3/4 oz Jamaican rum (preferably Smith and Cross)
3/4 oz bonded rye whiskey
3/4 oz honey syrup (1:1 honey and water)
3/4 oz lime juice
2 dashes Fee’s Whiskey Barrel-Aged Bitters
Shake and serve on the rocks. It’s really easy and the funkiness of the rum balances with spicy whiskey, sweet honey, and tart lime.
comments: The Fee’s bitters are great, but I can’t always find them. A substitute we use at Metrovino is a 1:1 mix of Angostura bitters and St. Elizabeth’s Allspice Dram.

title: The Colorado Dachshund
description: A whiskey, beer and grapefruit shandy  served on the rocks in a Collins glass, by Colt and Gray's Kevin Burke
recipe:
3/4 oz. Leopold's Straight Whiskey
3/4 oz. fresh grapefruit
1/4 oz. simple syrup
1 1/2 oz. Good Ginger Beer (Bundaberg)
1 dash Angostura Bitters
6 oz. Avery Joe's Pilsner 

Combine ingredients in an 11 oz. Collins glass, stirring gently to combine, add a few ice cubes and garnish with a Lemon Wheel.
comments: http://blogs.westword.com/cafesociety/2011/05/kevin_burke_colorado_cocktail_contest_1.php

title: Pegu Club
description: Bittersweet, Gin, Sweet Vermouth and Lime, served up
recipe:
1 1/2 oz. Beefeater 24
1/2  oz. Cointreau
1/2 oz. fresh lime juice
2 Dashes Angostura Bitters
Shake all ingredients and serve up

title: Nth Degree
description: Rhum and Applejack old fashioned with Green Chartreuse, with a big ice cube
recipe:
1 oz. Rhum Clement VSOP
1 oz Laird's Bonded apple brandy
.5 oz Green Chartreuse
1 cube demerara sugar
1 dash Fee bros Whiskey Barrel aged bitters
2 dashed bokers bitters
Muddle sugar cube and bitters
Stir all ingredients and strain over one large ice cube into a chilled rocks glass
Garnish with Orange and lemon twists
comments: From PDT Cocktail Book p194, inspired by old fashioned at Milk and Honey

title: Bee's Knees
description: Lemon, Gin, and Honey Syrup, served up
recipe:
2 oz. gin
1 tsp honey syrup
1 tsp fresh lemon juice
Garnish: lemon twist
Combine all ingredients in a shaker. Shake, strain into a chilled glass and garnish.

title: 50/50 Martini
description: Dry Gin and Dolin Blanc, Up with a lemon twist
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Your favorite Gin
1 1/2 oz Dolin Blanc
Dash Orange Bitters
Stir and server up with a lemon twist.

title: The Lion's Tail
description: Winter bourbon cocktail with Allspice Dram, served up
recipe:
2 oz Bourbon
1/2 oz Pimento Dram (Or less, to taste)
1/2 oz Lime Juice
1 tsp Tablespoon Simple Syrup
2 Dashes Angostura Bitters

title: Boulevardier
description: Bourbon, Campari and Sweet Vermouth served up
recipe:
1 1/2 oz. bourbon
1 oz. Campari
1 oz. sweet vermouth
Ice cubes
Tools: mixing glass, barspoon, strainer
Glass: cocktail
Garnish: orange slice, lemon twist or cherry
 
Stir long and well with ice in a mixing glass and strain into a cocktail glass.

title: Col. Carpano
description: Cynar, Bourbon and Sweet Vermouth, served up with an orange peel
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Cynar
1 1/2 oz Bourbon, Buffalo Trace
3/4 oz Sweet vermouth, Carpano Antica Formula
2 ds Peychaud's Bitters
1 twist Orange peel

Combine in a mixing glass then add large ice cubes. Stir then strain over large ice. Garnish with an orange peel expressed and inserted.

My comments: Absolutely delicious. The small amount of CAF is apparent. Nice lingering bitter. Made with Knob Creek. I think a high-proof bourbon helps.
comments: by Kyle Davidson, The Violet Hour, Chicago

title: The Smoking Frenchman
description: Cognac and Domain Canton Ginger liqueur, served up in a Islay malt rinsed glass with a lemon garnish
recipe:
2oz Pierre Ferrand Ambre Cognac 
1oz Canton
4 dashes angostura bitters
2 dash Lemon bitters 
Stir with ice 
Service up in Coupe rinsed w/ smoky scotch
Garish with lemon peel
comments: From Sean Kenyon

title: Autumn Sweater
description: Dark rum and Apple Whiskey combined with Spiced Falernum, served up.
recipe:
1 1/2 ounces Ron Zacapa rum
1 ounce Calvados
1 ounce Falernum
3/4 ounce fresh lemon juice
Dash Angostura bitters
Lemon wheel

Combine rum, calvados, Falernum, lemon, and bitters in a cocktail shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled coupe glass. Garnish with lemon wheel.
comments: This refined rum cocktail from Chicago's Sepia hides a festive Tiki core. A burnt-sugar backbone from the aged Guatemalan rum is deepened with the sweet, nutty, baking-spice notes of Falernum.

title: The Beatnik
description: Tawny port, Averna Amaro and Bourbon, served up.
recipe:
1/2 oz tawny port
1 1/2 oz Averna liqueur
1 oz small batch bourbon whiskey
flamed orange peel for garnish

Rinse a cocktail glass with port and pour into a cocktail shaker with the remaining ingredients.
Stir 30 times over ice.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a flamed orange peel.
comments: created by mixologist Duggan McDonnell

title: Fancy Cognac Cocktail
description: Cognac cocktail with Dry Orange Curacao
recipe:
Put 1 tsp. (5 ml) superfine or caster sugar in a mixing glass
Add 1 tsp. (5 ml) water and stir to dissolve sugar
Add 1 tsp. (5 ml) Pierre Ferrand Dry Orange Curacao
Add 2 oz (60 ml) Pierre Ferrand 1840 Original Formula Cognac
Fill glass with cracked ice and stir well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass and twist a swatch of thin-cut lemon peel over the top.
comments: Source: Jerry Thomas, How to Mix Drinks, 1862. Adapted by David Wondrich.

title: Peychaud Collins
description: Peychaud's bitters with Lemon, St. Germain, Strawberries and Cucumber.
recipe:
2oz Peychaud's
1 oz lemon 
.5 simple 
.5 st Germain. 
Pinch salt. Muddled strawberry and cucumber.
comments: From Kevin Burke

title: The Lush Interlude
description: Dark and tart, Rum, Zucca Amaro, Royal Combier and lime served up with an orange twist
recipe:
1oz El Dorado 5 year rum
1oz Zucca amaro
1/2oz Royal Combier
3/4oz fresh lime juice
1/4oz demerara syrup (2:1, rich syrup)
Shake, strain into a coupe or cocktail glass and garnish with an orange peel.
comments: From Braden Lagrone at Cure in New Orleans

title: Hemingway Daiquiri
description: Classic Hemingway Daiquiri with rum, lime juice, grapefruit juice, and maraschino liqueur.  Served up.
recipe:
1 1/2 oz. white rum 
3/4 oz. fresh lime juice 
1/4 oz. fresh grapefruit juice
1/4 oz. maraschino liqueur
Shake and serve up, lime garnish

title: Pago Pago Cocktail
description: Pineapple, Rum, Green Chartruese, and Crème de cacao.  Served up.
recipe:
3 Squares of fresh pineapple
1/2 oz fresh lime juice
1/2 oz green Chartreuse
1/4 oz white creme de cacao
1 1/2 oz gold Puerto Rican rum

Place pineapple, lime juice, Chartreuse and creme de cacao in a cocktail shaker. Muddle thoroughly. Add rum and ice cubes. Shake well, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
comments: http://boulderlibation.blogspot.com/2010/12/pago-pago-cocktail.html

title: Jungle Bird
description: A tropically inspired 1970s sipper from the Aviary bar in Kuala Lumpur. Dark rum, Campari, Pineapple and Lime juices. Served on the rocks
recipe:
1 1/2 oz. blackstrap rum
3/4 oz. Campari 
1/2 oz. fresh lime juice
1/2 oz. simple syrup (1:1)
1 1/2 oz. pineapple juice

Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice cubes and strain into an Old Fashioned glass filled ice.

title: Green Swizzle
description: Trinidad's peerless Green Swizzle (ca. 1890) with Rum, falernum, and wormwood bitters.  Served over crushed ice with an Angostura bitters float.
recipe:
2 oz Banks 5 Rum
1 oz Velvet falernum (try 1/2)
1/2 oz lime juice
1 barspoon wormwood bitters or absinthe
Angostora Bitters

Combine all ingredients into a collins glass. Fill collins glass all the way with finely cracked or shaved ice. Add seltzer to fill. Swizzle until the glass frosts or you tire of swizzling, whichever occurs first. Top with 6 dashes Ango
comments: http://www.esquire.com/features/drinking/swizzle-recipe-0813

title: Rum manhattan
description: A twist on the classic with Rum, sweet vermouth,  maraschino and orange bitters
recipe:
2 ounces aged rhum agricole (see headnote)
1 ounce sweet vermouth, preferably Carpano Antica
1/2 teaspoon maraschino liqueur
1 dash orange bitters
Twist of orange peel, for garnish

Stir all ingredients, serve either up or on a large ice cube.

title: Hanky Panky
description: Gin and Sweet Vermouth with a dash of Fernet
recipe:
1 1/2 Oz Gin
1 1/2 Oz Sweet Vermouth
1 barspoon Fernet Branca

Stir over ice and serve up with a orange twist
comments: Created at the Savoy hotel byAda Coleman. "By Jove, that is the real Hanky Panky!" - Charles Hawtrey

title: Figgy Tonic
description: Aged rum, figs and tawny port, lemon and tonic in a collins glass
recipe:
2 oz. aged rum 
2 figs (fresh or dried)
1/4 oz. ruby Port
1/4 oz.lemon juice
1/4 oz 1:1 Simple Syrup
3-4 oz. tonic water
Tools: paring knife, muddler, mixing glass, barspoon, strainer
Glass: Collins
Garnish: straw and halved fig

Halve figs with a sharp paring knife and muddle in a mixing glass with lemon juice and Port. Add rum and stir with ice cubes until well chilled. Strain into an ice-filled Collins glass, top with tonic and garnish.

title: Springtime in Rome
description: Campari, dry vermouth and lime,  refreshing and low alcohol.  Served over ice in a collins glass.
recipe:
1.5 oz Campari 
1 oz dry vermouth 
3/4 oz lime
1/4 oz simple syrup

Shake and serve over ice in a collins glass.
Twist of orange peel.

title: Chupacabra
description: Rosemary Tequila with Triple Sec, Orange Juice and Lime Jucie.  Served up.
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Rosemary Tequila
1/2 oz Triple Sec
1/2 oz Orange Juice
1 oz Lime Juice
1/2 oz Simple Syrup

Shake and serve with an orange twist.
comments: Rosemary Tequila - Infuse 1 bottle of silver tequila, 6 sprigs of rosemary overnight. Original Cocktail from Lou's Food Bar in Denver.

title: El Presidente
description: Rum, Bianco vermouth with Pierre Ferrand Dry Curacao.  Served up with an orange twist.
recipe:
2oz Bacardi 8yr
1 oz martini Bianco Vermouth
1/2 oz Pierre Ferrand Dry Curacao

Stri and serve up with an orange twist

title: Autumn Negroni
description: A twist on a traditional Negroni.  Gin and Sweet vermouth with Five bittering agents;  Campari, Cynar, Fernet Branca, Orange bitters, and Peychaud’s bitters. Layers of flavor.
recipe:
2oz dry gin (Beefeater)
0.75oz Carpano Antica sweet vermouth
0.5oz Cynar
0.5oz Campari
0.25oz Fernet Branca
1 dash orange bitters (Angostura)
1 dash Peychaud’s bitters
Stir over ice and strain into coupe glass; garnish with orange peel.

title: Rum Punch
description: Rum, Lemon, Lime and Black Tea

title: Negroni
description: Classic Italian cocktail with Gin, Campari and Sweet Vermouth.  Served on the rocks with an orange slice
recipe:
1 oz Gin
1 oz Campari
1 oz Sweet Vermouth
Pour over ice and garnish with an orange slice

title: Garrick Club Punch
description: Gin, Lemon, and Orange liqueur

title: Cosmo
description: You know, a cosmo
recipe:
2 Oz Vodka
1 Oz Triple Sec
1 Oz Cranberry
1 Oz Rose's Lime

title: Goonie
description: Citrus Vodka, Lillet, Lemon Juice, and Cranberry Simple Syrup in a collins glass with soda water.
recipe:
1.5 nectarine vodka (or citrus vodka)
.5 Lillet  
.5 lemon
.5 cranberry simple syrup
Top with soda
comments: Formerly "A ride in Troy's bucket" from the Goonies at the Squeaky Bean

title: Le Bateleur
description: Dry Gin, Punt e Mes, Strega, Cynar, and Angostora Bitters.  Served up with an organce twist.
recipe:
2 OUNCES BEEFEATER LONDON DRY GIN 
¾ OUNCE PUNT E MES 
½ OUNCE STREGA 
¼ OUNCE CYNAR 
1 DASH ANGOSTURA BITTERS 
GARNISH: 1 ORANGE TWIST 
Stir all the ingredients over ice, then strain into a coupe. Garnish with the orange twist.
comments: Death and Co ALEX DAY, 2008

title: The Black Prince
description: A Rum manhattan with Punt e Mes and Amaro Averna. Served up.
recipe:
2 OUNCES ZACAPA 23- YEAR RUM 
¾ OUNCE PUNT E MES 
½ OUNCE AMARO AVERNA 
1 DASH HOUSE ORANGE BITTERS 
Stir all the ingredients over ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.
comments: Death and Co, PHIL WARD, 2008

title: Little Birdy
description: Flavored Vodka, St Germain, Grapefruit, and Lemon Juice. Served up.
recipe:
2 Oz Flavored Vodka, or STRAWBERRY- AND PINEAPPLE- INFUSED MACCHU PISCO
½ OUNCE ST- GERMAIN 
¾ OUNCE GRAPEFRUIT JUICE 
½ OUNCE LEMON JUICE 
1 TEASPOON SIMPLE SYRUP 
Shake all the ingredients with ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.
comments: Death and Co, JOAQUÍN SIMÓ, 2009 This is one that I call a “roast chicken” drink, meaning everyone likes it. I didn’t name it after chicken, though, but for pisco , the Quechuan word for “bird.”— JS 2 OUNCES

title: East India Trading Co.
description: Aged Rum, East India Solera Sherry, Amaro Ramazzotti, Mole bitters. Served up.
recipe:
2 OUNCES APPLETON ESTATE RESERVE RUM 
¾ OUNCE LUSTAU EAST INDIA SOLERA SHERRY 
½ OUNCE RAMAZZOTTI 
2 DASHES BITTERMENS XOCOLATL MOLE BITTERS 
Stir all the ingredients over ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.
comments: Death and Co. BRIAN MILLER, 2009

title: La Rosita
description: Reposado Tequila, Sweet Vermouth, Dry Vermouth, Campari, and Angostura Bitters. Served Up with an Orange Twist.
recipe:
2 OUNCES EL TESORO REPOSADO TEQUILA 
½ OUNCE CAMPARI 
½ OUNCE COCCHI VERMOUTH DI TORINO 
½ OUNCE DOLIN DRY VERMOUTH 
1 DASH ANGOSTURA BITTERS 
GARNISH: 1 ORANGE TWIST 
Stir all the ingredients over ice, then strain into a Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with the orange twist.

title: Brooklyn
description: Rye, Dry Vermouth, Amer Picon, and Luxardo Maraschino.  Served up.
recipe:
2 ounces rye whiskey
1 ounce dry vermouth
1 Barspoon maraschino liqueur
1/4 ounce Amer Picon (or 1/4 ounce Bigallet China-China Amer or 2 dashes Angostura bitters)
Garnish: Luxardo maraschino cherry

title: Decolletage
description: Reposado Tequila, Dubonet, Aperol, and Fernet Branca.  Served on the rocks with an orange twist.
recipe:
1 1/2 ounces reposado tequila
1 ounce Dubonnet Rouge
1/2 ounce Aperol
1/4 ounce Fernet Branca
garnish: orange twist
comments: Chris Hannah of French 75 Bar in New Orleans

title: Little Italy
description: Rye, Cynar, and Sweet Vermouth.  Served up with cherries.
recipe:
2 oz. rye (Saunders uses Rittenhouse 100)
1/2 oz. Cynar
3/4 oz. sweet vermouth (Saunders uses Martini & Rossi)
Ice cubes
Tools: mixing glass, barspoon, strainer
Glass: small cocktail
Garnish: 2 Luxardo cherries, skewered
comments: Pegu Club’s Audrey Saunders

title: Prospect Park
description: Rye, Aperol, Maraschino, and Punt e Mes
recipe:
1 1⁄2 	oz	Rye
1 1⁄2 	oz	Aperol
1⁄4 	oz	Maraschino Liqueur, Luxardo
1⁄4 	oz	Simple syr (try less, too sweet)
1⁄2 	oz	Sweet vermouth, Carpano Punt e Mes
1	 	Maraschino cherry (as garnish)
comments: Riff on a Red Hook from Eastern Standard in Boston.

title: Carroll Gardens
description: Rye, Punt e Mes, Nardini Amaro, and Maraschino.  Served up
recipe:
2 oz Rittenhouse rye 
1/2 oz Punt e Mes sweet vermouth 
1/2 oz Nardini Amaro 
1 teaspoon maraschino liqueur 
Garnish: lemon twist
Stir over ice and strain into a coupe.  Squeeze the lemon twist over the drink and discard.
comments: Joaquin Simo of Death & Co

title: Bird’s Eye View
description: Bourbon, Ramazzotti Amaro, Carpano Antica vermouth, and Yellow Chartreuse. Served up.
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Eagle Rare Bourbon
3/4 oz Ramazzotti Amaro
1/2 oz Carpano Antica
1/4 oz Yellow Chartreuse
1 lemon twist, as an aromatic garnish.
Stir over ice and strain into a chilled wine glass.  Twist the lemon twist over surface and discard.
comments: 101 Best New Cocktails: Bird’s Eye View by Steve Shur, Boston College Club, Boston, MA

title: St. Joseph's
description: Cynar, Aperol, Averna, and Pedro Ximenez Sherry.  Served on the rocks with an Orange Twist.
recipe:
1 oz Cynar
.5 oz Aperol
.5 oz Averna
.5 oz Pedro Ximenez sherry
1 orange twist, as garnish
Stir over ice and and serve on the rocks.  Garinsh with the orange twist.
comments: 101 Best New Cocktails: St. Joseph’s by Chris Hannah, French 75 Bar , New Orleans

title: Pressure Drop
description: Old Tom Gin, Amaro, Dry Vermouth, Eau de vie and bitters, served up
recipe:
1 1⁄2 o	z 	Old Tom Gin, Ransom
1 oz 	Amaro Meletti
1⁄2 o	z 	Dry vermouth, Dolin
1	sp 	Pear eau de vie, Clear Creek
1 dash Angostura 	Bitters

Stir all ingredients and serve up
comments: From Death and Co

title: Cucumber Rickey
description: Twist on a traditional Rickey.  Gin, Cucumber, and Lime Juice, on the rocks in a tall glass
recipe:
2 oz Gin
2 slices Cucumber
1 oz Freshly pressed lime juice
3/4 oz Simple syrup
1 1/2 oz Soda water

Muddle cucumber
Add remaining spirits and mixers (but not soda water)
Add ice and shake vigorously
Fine strain into an ice filled collins glass
Top with soda water
Garnish with a cucumber wheel & a lime wedge
comments: http://aviationgin.com/recipes/aviation-cucumber-rickey/

title: Ancho Old Fashioned
description: Tequilia Old Fashioned with slightly spicy Ancho Reyes Chile Liqueur, on a big ice cube.
recipe:
1 oz Milagro Silver Tequila
1 oz Ancho Reyes Ancho Chile Liqueur
.25 oz Rich simple syrup
3 dashes Angostura bitters
2 dashes Angostura Orange Bitters
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.

Stir, and strain into a double Old Fashioned glass filled with one large ice block.

Garnish with Lemon and Orange peel
comments: http://liquor.com/recipes/ancho-old-fashioned/#gs.D00rNVc

title: Margarita
description: The classic Margarita recipe—a simple mix of tequila, lime and Cointreau
recipe:
2 oz. silver tequila (or reposado if you like)
1 oz. fresh lime juice
3/4 oz. Cointreau

Garnish: lime wheel and salt (optional)

Combine ingredients with ice in a shaker and shake vigorously. Strain into an ice-filled glass and garnish.

title: Mai Tai
description: Classic Mai Tai.  Rum, Lime, and Orgeat on the rocks
recipe:
1 oz. amber Martinique rum
1 oz. aged Jamaican rum
1 oz. fresh lime juice
1/2 oz. orange curaçao
1/2 oz. orgeat
1/4 oz. simple syrup (1:1)
Combine all ingredients in a shaker and add crushed ice. Shake for 10 seconds and pour, unstrained into a glass. Garnish with mint

title: Japanese Cocktail
description: Cognac, Orgeat, and Angostura bitters.  Served up.
recipe:
2 ounces cognac
1/2 ounce orgeat syrup
3 dashes Bitters -- Angostura bitters
Stir ingredients well with cracked ice, then strain into a chilled cocktail glass and garnish with a twist of lemon peel.
comments: From Death and Co

title: Flamenco
description: Sherry, Genever, Orange juice, Lemon Juice, Orgeat, and bitters, served up
recipe:
1 1/2 OZ LUSTAU AMONTILLADO SHERRY 
1 OZ BOLS GENEVER 
1/2 OZ ORANGE JUICE 
1/2 OZ LEMON JUICE 
3/4 OZ ORGEAT 
2 DASHES ANGOSTURA BITTERS 
Shake all the ingredients with ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.

title: La Cola Nostra
description: Agricole Rhum, Averna, Lime Juice, and Pimento Dram. Topped with Prosecco or soda
recipe:
1 oz Averna
2 oz Ron Zacapa Centenario 23yr
3/4 oz Lime Juice
1/2oz Simple Syrup
1/4 oz St. Elizabeth Allspice Dram
1 1/2 oz Fantinel Prosecco
1 Lime Wedge

Shake and strain into a Collins glass with block ice, top with Prosecco, garnish with lime wedge.

I like it with soda instead of the prosecco too. - DB
comments: Bartender Don Lee won $1,500 for this cocktail as part of a contest sponsored by Averna

title: Fog Cutter
description: The Fog Cutter is a classic concoction from the legendary Victor "Trader Vic" Bergeron.
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Appleton white rum
3/4 oz cognac 
1/2 gin 
1 1/2 oz Orange Juice
1/2 oz Lemon
1/2 oz orgeat 

shake strain into a double old fashioned glass, float a generous amount of Cream Sherry
comments: Shake all ingredients except sherry and strain over ice into collins glass. Top with sherry.

title: La Nosy Costra
description: Refreshing with Cynar, Rum, Lime Juice, Angostura and Soda water. On the rocks in a tall glass.
recipe:
1 oz Cynar
2 oz Ron Zacapa Centenario 23yr
3/4 oz Lime Juice
1/2oz Simple Syrup (2:1)
2 Dashes Angostura bitters

Shake all strain into a tall ice filled glass,  top with Soda Garnish with Lime or Mint

title: Queen's Park Swizzle
description: Demerara rum, Lime, simple syrup and fresh mint topped with Angostura bitters and served in a swizzle glass.
recipe:
3 oz Demerara Rum
.75 oz Lime Juice
.5 oz Simple Syrup
6-8 mint leaves
3 Heavy Dashes Angostura Bitters
Fresh Mint

Add ingredients and shell of the lime you just juiced into a tall glass.  Fill the glass with crushed ice and swizzle until the glass frosts over.  Garnish with a large sprig of mint.  Serve with a straw.

title: Southpaw
description: Bourbon, Punt e Mes, Campari, and Fernet.  Bitter and stirred with a hint of mint.  Served up
recipe:
1 oz Bourbon (Four Roses)
1/2 oz Punt e Mes
1/2 oz Campari
1 barspoon Fernet Branca 
2 dash Peychaud's Bitters

Stir with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange twist.

title: Skanky Panky
description: Gin, vermouth, Crème de Cacao, and Fernet Branca. Served up with a lemon twist
recipe:
2 oz Gin
3⁄4 oz Sweet vermouth, Carpano Punt e Mes
1⁄4 oz Crème de Cacao
1⁄4 oz Fernet Branca
1 dash Orange bitters
1 twist Lemon peel

Stir all ingredients and strain into a coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
comments: http://www.kindredcocktails.com/cocktail/sun-stealer

title: Daiquiri
description: The classic Daiquiri - Rum, Lime Juice and Simple Syrup.  Served up.
recipe:
2 oz. white rum
1 oz. fresh lime juice
1/2 oz. simple syrup (1:1)
Combine ingredients in a shaker with ice, shake to chill and strain into a chilled glass.
Garnish with Lime slice

title: Manhattan
description: Classic Manhattan - Rye or Bourbon, Sweet vermouth and Bitters.  Served up.
recipe:
2 oz. bourbon or rye
1 oz. sweet vermouth
2 dashes Angostura bitters
Stir ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, strain into a chilled glass and garnish with Cherry or orange zest

title: Mint Julep
description: Bourbon, Mint, Sugar, Angostura bitters and Ice. "Who has not tasted one has lived in vain."  - Joshua Soule Smith, a Kentucky Colonel writing in the 1890s
recipe:
2 oz bourbon (Kentucky straight bourbon, best you have)
2 teaspoons (1/3 oz) 2:1 simple syrup 
Fresh mint (spearmint)
2-3 dashes Angostura bitters (optional)

Lightly crush mint with sugar and ango, add bourbon, pour into ice filled julep glass.  Stir, fill with more ice, then garnish with mint.
comments: King of Julep Makers. That bartender is Chris McMillian.

title: Bitter Pill
description: Aged rum and Fernet make for a spirited match in the assertive Bitter Pill cocktail.  On the rocks.
recipe:
1 1/2 oz aged rum (Zaya 12-year)
1/2 oz Fernet Branca
1/2 oz fresh lime juice
1/4 oz demerara sugar syrup (2:1)
1/2 oz fresh egg white (pasteurized if you like)

Shake ingredients with ice and strain into an ice-filled glass. Garnish by twisting the peel over the finished drink.
comments: Richard Swan, Cliff’s Edge, Los Angeles

title: All In
description: Rye whiskey, Campari, dry vermouth, and crème de cacao.  Bitter and savory, served up.
recipe:
1 1/2 ounces rye (preferably Bulleit)
3/4 ounce dry vermouth (preferably Dolin)
3/4 ounce Campari
1/4 ounce crème de cacao
lemon peel

Stir all and strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Express a lemon twist over top to release oils. Discard.
comments: Nearly an Old Pal, the New York City bar Nitecap.

title: The Amen Corner
description: Bourbon, Aperol, Amaro and Mint.  Served up.
recipe:
2 oz. bourbon
1 oz. Aperol
¾ oz. Amaro Nonino
4-5 mint leaves
Tools: shaker, strainer
Glass: coupe
Garnish: brandied cherries

Gently muddle the mint in a mixing glass. Add the remaining ingredients, plus ice, then shake until chilled. Double-strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish.
comments: This beauty was created by PDT alumni and bartender Nick Brown as a play on Sam Ross’ Paper Plane cocktail.

title: Trinidad Sour (modified)
description: Angostura Amaro, Orgeat, Lemon, and Rye in an bitter based cocktail, served up.
recipe:
1 oz Amaro di Angostura plus 3-4 dashes Angostura Bitters (or 1 oz Angostura bitters - This is traditional)
3/4 oz orgeat
3/4 oz lemon juice
3/4 oz rye whiskey (100-proof preferred)

Shake and serve up

title: Sidecar
description: Classic cocktail with Cognac, Cointreau, and Lemon.  Served up with a sugar rim
recipe:
2 oz Cognac
1 oz Cointreau
3/4 oz fresh lemon juice

Garnish: sugared rim (optional)

Shake ingredients with ice and strain into a chilled glass

title: Southside
description: Gin, Lemon, and Mint.  Served up.
recipe:
2 oz London dry gin
1 oz Fresh lemon juice
5  Mint leaves
1/2 oz 2:1 Simple syrup

Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.

Garnish with a mint sprig or lemon twist and mint

title: Cynar Spritz
description: Cynar, Prosecco, and grapefruit soda served on the rocks
recipe:
3 oz Prosecco
2 oz Cynar
1 oz grapefruit soda

Fill large wine glass with ice, add Prosecco, Cynar,  and club soda. Garnish with grapefruit wedge

title: Bamboo
description: Low alcohol Vermouth and Sherry. Complex but not too heavy. Stirred and served up.
recipe:
1.5 oz. Dolin dry vermouth
1.5 oz. dry sherry Manzanilla or Amontillado
2 dashes orange bitters 
1 dash Angostura bitters 

Stir ingredients with ice and strain into glass. Twist orange peel or Lemon peel over glass and drop in.

title: Hotel Nacional Special
description: Named after Havana's Hotel Nacional bar.  Rum, lime, pineapple, and apricot liqueur.
recipe:
2 oz aged rum
1/2 oz apricot liqueur
1 oz pineapple
1/2 oz lime
barspoon simple
comments: Will P . Taylor, who created this drink at the Nacional bar in Cuba, was the Old Waldorf-Astoria's last manager before Prohibition shuttered the bar. —Bar La Florida Cocktails, 1933

title: The Junior
description: Rye Lime and Benedicine for a daiquiri like whiskey twist.  Served up.
recipe:
2 oz Rye 
1/2 oz Benedictine
1/2 oz Lime Juice
Two dashes Angostura Bitters

title: Flor De Jerez
description: Lower proof Sherry, Rum, Apricot, Lemon juce, served up.
recipe:
.5 ounce Appleton Estate Reserve Rum
1.5 ounces Lustau Amontillado Sherry
.25 ounce Rothman & Winter Apricot Liqueur
.75 ounce Lemon Juice
.5 ounce Rich Cane Sugar Syrup
1 dash Angostura Bitters

Shake all the ingredients with ice, then strain into a coupe. No garnish.
comments: Flor De Jerez from Death & Co

title: Longshoreman
description: A simple variation on the Manhattan, the Longshoreman was invented by bartender Abigail Gullo, who substitutes Sicilian amaro Averna for Angostura bitters.
recipe:
2 ounces rye whiskey
1/2 ounce Averna amaro
1/2 ounce Punt e Mes
Garnish: flamed orange peel
Don’t skip out on the flamed orange peel, which adds a bit of flair, as well as a burned citrus finish, to the Longshoreman.

Stirred up
comments: Don’t skip out on the flamed orange peel, which adds a bit of flair, as well as a burned citrus finish, to the Longshoreman.

title: Lucien Gaudin
description: A classic gin cocktail in the neighborhood of the Negroni but with amplified flavors of bitter orange from the addition of dry vermouth and orange liqueur.
recipe:
1 oz. London dry gin
1/2 oz. Campari
1/2 oz. Cointreau
1/2 oz. dry vermouth
Tools: mixing glass, barspoon, strainer
Glass: Nick and Nora
Garnish: orange twist

Combine all of the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice and stir to chill. Strain into a chilled glass and garnish.

title: Paper Plane
description: Bourbon, Aperol, Amaro and Lemon juice, shaken and served up
recipe:
3/4 oz. bourbon
3/4 oz. Aperol
3/4 oz. Amaro Nonino
3/4 oz. fresh lemon juice
Tools: shaker, strainer
Glass: coupe
Garnish: lemon twist

Add all the ingredients with ice to shaker. Shake and strain into a chilled coupe, then garnish.
comments: Originally invented by Sam Ross (creator of the Penicillin cocktail),

title: Friends Like These
description: Rye, Amaro, Peach liqueur, anmd Lemon juice
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Rye
1/2 oz Amaro Montenegro
1/2 oz Peach liqueur
3/4 oz Lemon Juice
1/2 oz demerrera (2:1)
3 dashes Angostura Bitters

Shake and double strain over rocks
Lemon Twist

title: The Parisian #2
description: Gin, Dry vermouth, Lemon, Crème de Cassis, up and frosty
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Gin
1 oz Dry Vermouth
1/2 oz lemon Juice
Scant 1/2 oz crème de cassis

Shake and strain into a glass that was furlouged from its silent vigil in the icy darkness of your freezer
comments: From David Wondrich's wife, Karen Rush

title: The Metropole
description: Cognac, Blanc vermouth, Orange and Peychaud's bitters.  Served up or on the rocks
recipe:
1 1/2 oz Cognac
1 1/2 oz Blanc Vermouth
2 Dashes Orange Bitters
2 Dashes Peychaud's Bitters

Stir and serve up with a lemon twist
comments: From David Wondrich's lo fi lush hour on twitter during Covid Lockdowns

title: Ce Soir
description: Cognac, Cynar, Yellow Chartreuse, and bitters, served up.
recipe:
2 oz Cognac, preferably Pierre Ferrand 1840 Original Formula
3/4 oz Cynar
1/2 oz Yellow Chartreuse
1 dash Angostura Bitters
1 dash Regan’s No. 6 Orange Bitters
Lemon twist to express over drink

Stir all ingredients and strain into a chilled coupe. Express lemon twist over the surface of the drink and discard.
comments: Nicole Lebevevich, The Hawthorne, Boston, 2010

title: Bitter Intentions
description: Campari, Vemouth and Lemon in a cross between a bitter highball and a sour.
recipe:
2 Oz Campari
3/4 Oz lemon juice
3/4 Oz simple syrup 1:1
1 1/2 Oz soda water
1 Oz sweet vermouth (preferably Carpano Antica)
Garnish: orange slice

Pour the soda water in a Collins glass without ice.
Shake the Campari, lemon, and simple syrup with ice and strain into the glass.
Add cracked ice.
Top with the Carpano Antica Vermouth and garnish with an orange slice.
comments: From Bobby Heugel

title: Dry Martini
description: Classic Dry Martini - Gin and vermouth
recipe:
1.75 oz Hayman’s Royal Dock or Plymouth Navy Strength gin
1.25 oz Noilly Prat or Dolin Dry vermouth
2 dashes The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters
Garnish: Twist of thin-cut lemon peel
Glass: Cocktail
comments: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11jmZXtaVUh79ehyo_0VdcBmxuTWXUv9pebwHc0ErF1I/edit#gid=0

title: Dry Gibson
description: Classic Dry Gibson - Gin and vermouth with a housemade cocktail onion
recipe:
2 oz tanqueray 10 (47.3%) or 2.25 oz lower proof gin (40-42%)
3/4 oz Noilly Prat or Dolin Dry vermouth
2 dashes The Bitter Truth Orange Bitters
Garnish: Cocktail onion
Glass: Cocktail
comments: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11jmZXtaVUh79ehyo_0VdcBmxuTWXUv9pebwHc0ErF1I/edit#gid=0

title: Strawberry Daiquiri
description: Stawberry infused rum, lime juice and sugar
recipe:
2 oz Strawberry infused rum
3/4 oz Lime
3/4 oz 1:1 simple syrup
comments: 1 l of rum 16 oz straberries sousvice 137 for 1 hr, strain and chill

title: The Brooks
description: Rum, Velvet Falernum, Cynar, and Lime Juice.  Shaken and served up.
recipe:
3/4 oz Smith and Cross
3/4 oz Velvet Falernum
3/4 oz Cynar
3/4 oz Lime Juice

Shake all ingredients and double strain into a chilled nick and nora.  Grapefruit twist optional.
comments: Theo Lieberman (Milk & Honey)

title: Artichoke Hold
description: Jamaican Rum, Cyna, St. Germain elderflower liqueur, lime juice and orgeat over crushed ice.
recipe:
3/4 oz Jamaican rum (preferably Smith & Cross)
3/4 oz Cynar
1/2 oz St. Germain elderflower liqueur
3/4 oz lime juice
1/2 oz orgeat

Shake Strain over crushed ice in a rocks glass.  Garnish with Mint
comments: Jeremy Oertel uses in his playfully-titled “Artichoke Hold” at Brooklyn cocktail bar Donna.

title: The Art of Choke
description: Light rum, Cynar, Green Chartreuse, mint and a little lime juice.  Served on the rocks.
recipe:
1 oz Light Rum
1 oz Cynar
1/4 oz Green Chartreuse
3/4 tsp Lime Juice
3/4 tsp rich Demerara Syrup
6 Mint Leaves

Place about 6 mint leaves in a mixing glass.
Add ingredients into the mixing glass.
Lightly press the leaves to release its oils.
Add ice and stir then double strain in a rock glass with fresh ice.
Garnish Mint Sprig
comments: Kyle Davidson at The Violet Hour in Chicago
